content.question: A rocket of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> is launched from the surface of Earth with an initial speed equal to one-half the escape speed. The mass and the radius of Earth are <math alttext="6.0 times 10 raised to the 24 power, kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>24</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>kg</mtext></math> and <math alttext="6.4 times 10 raised to the 6 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>, respectively. What is the maximum altitude achieved by the rocket? Assume air resistance is negligible.

choices.label: <math alttext="9.1 times 10 raised to the 5 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>9.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>5</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>
<math alttext="2.1 times 10 raised to the 6 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>
<math alttext="6.4 times 10 raised to the 6 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>
<math alttext="1.9 times 10 raised to the 7 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.9</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>7</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>
<math alttext="4.5 times 10 raised to the 7 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>7</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2.1 times 10 raised to the 6 power, meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>6</mn></msup><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
